author: Sacha Pisani
title: Edin Dzeko, Mohamed Salah join Roma on permanent basis
text:
Edin Dzeko, Mohamed Salah join Roma on permanent basis FOXSports 3 hrs ago Sacha Pisani Â© AFP/Getty Images Roma's midfielder Mohamed Salah from Egypt (R) celebrates after scoring with Roma's forward Edin Dzeko from Bosnia-Herzegovina during the Italian Serie A football match Sampdoria vs Roma on September 23, 2015 at Luigi Ferraris Stadium in Genoa. Sampdoria won the match 2-1. AFP PHOTO / MARCO BERTORELLO (Photo credit should read MARCO BERTORELLO/AFP/Getty Images) Roma has confirmed that deals for Edin Dzeko and Mohamed Salah have been made permanent.
A financial statement published Thursday confirmed loanees Dzeko and Salah will remain in the Italian capital beyond the 2015-16 Serie A season.
AdChoices Dzeko and Salah joined Roma on season-long loans from Premier League clubs Manchester City and Chelsea, respectively, with the Bosnian netting the winner against reigning champion Juventus earlier in the season.
"These players were first signed on a temporary basis, which has been transformed into definitive transfers after planned contractual conditions were met," read a Roma statement, which also revealed a permanent deal for Genoa winger Iago Falque.
Dzeko, who is sidelined with a twisted knee, has scored once since arriving in Rome, while teammate Salah has bagged three goals, leaving the capital club sixth in the table, four points off Serie A leader Fiorentina.
